p: Breast cancer is a commonly diagnosed cancer in Malaysia, having a standardized age rate of 47.4 per 100,000 [ 4, 5]. The National Cancer Registry of Malaysia (NCR) records that 21,773 Malaysians who are perceived with cancer and approximations show that unregistered cases have reached about 10,000 cases every year. It is likely that by 75 years old, Â¼ of Malaysians will be diagnosed with cancer [ 6]. Therefore, discovering new drugs with minimal toxicity is a broad scientific challenge, and there is an immediate need to search for a new agent to mitigate the menace by using alternative evidence-based herbal medicines.
